[mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 22 October 2009 10:54
To: Deborah Elstein
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: linking

Janos, I don't really understand Deb's last comment. But I'm pretty sure the problem can be reproduced like this:
1) open a page for editing and select some text to link
2) click the "Link" tool 
3) as soon as the picker has loaded, swap to the browse panel (ie. before it's had a chance to load "quick search" results)
4) you get a blank results panel.

One solution would be to disable the mode buttons until the initial result load is finished. But obv that's not a very good fix! Would be better if it just worked smoothly if the user follows these steps. I guess if you check in the success handler for whether the mode has changed this will be fairly straightforward.

I can't reproduce this for the first try, but on ie8 the whole dialog box disappears when i try to switch to browse panel. also there are couple of javascript error for each click (ie7 & 8). trying again on a native box.

subject: Add a external site icon for external hyperlinks in rich text [body text] container

comments.value:
A new icon to appear 'inline' next to any external hyperlink to an external site in rich text areas.

[Liz] Just to clarify is this any text link (in rich text fields) that goes to an external site?

Related to this ticket, which /just/ deals with the related links nav bar (which is the simpler case)
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/665

* as yet we have not estimated this work, it is a core CMS change to the way rich text areas are output so may not even be possible (within a sensible budget).

Assignin thsi to you to see if you have any thought on the best place to do it, I guess we could do it via JS once the page has loaded (which would mean we could strip it out quickly if needed). Or woudl it be better / cleaner to add it into the publication.xsl (or similar layer?)

This sounds more complicated than I had thought.
There are few classes of a hrefs.
1. Hard coded in templates.
2. Rich text containers.
3. Hyperlink containers.
4. Generated code (e.g. links copied from other pages, etc.)

Also, are there likely to be rules for some fragments, and not for others?
E.g. "Add the image for body text, but not in any <h1> elements", or something like that?
Or "Display a different logo depending on the background color"?

Or am I overcomplicating this Jamie?

No I think it's probably a complex bit of work, which we may be able 
to break down into separate areas, but yes certainly not a trivial 
change that can be covered in a single ticket and one with possible 
unforeseen consequences (at least in some cases)

[This ticket was really to investigate the feasibility of 4. below 
Rich text containers ]

1) Hard coded text links in templates / components

We'd first need to identify all these, agree what to do in each case 
and then change them in templates / components.

2) Automatic Nav bars

I have already broken out the 'related link' nav bar as a separate 
ticket http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/665 that is pretty straight 
forward / self contained.

But yes there are plenty of other query generated nav bars and like 
the hard coded text links they need to be identified and dealt with 
on a case by case basis, some may need bigger or smaller icons, others 
may not want an icon but a pop up label etc.

3) Hyperlinks

Much the same issues and 1 and 2, need to identify them and dealt with 
on a case by case basis

4) Rich text containers

This is the case I was describing in this ticket, the more complex 
case is /any/ rich text container, the simpler case (but not without 
issues) is the main text containers on content pages called 'body'.

--

I was going to suggest to Liz that we could tackle the 'related links' 
nar bar [ http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/665 ] and was going to 
suggest we possibly (depending on complexity / work involved) deal 
with the rich text 'body' container as a starting point.

It sound like a mix of a call back and a container value (or list of) 
may be the solution to dealing with a subset of rich text container 
ie. the body container.

Be good if you could give some thought to the above but I think I 
probably need to discuss this further with Liz as it may not have been 
apparent what the the pit-falls / different cases / technical issues 
here were and therefore need to get agreement on whether it is worth 
us progressing on dealing with a subset of the cases.

Lets leave this ticket for a discussion of the body / rich-text 
container.

If we need to deal with other cases by other means let open separate 
tickets for them, ie. http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/665

thanks

Jamie

If it's proving to be difficult to figure out if we've put in an external site, would it not be possible for us to just tick a box (much in the same way we tick 'open in new window' that says, 'this is an external site' and when we tick that box the little logo appears? Obv we'd have to manually go change some of the existing links, but i don't think there are *that* many of them in pages...

 _____

That doesn;t realyl help solve the root issue, links in nav bars may not even be stored anywhere (if they are generated automatically), the ones in body text are stored as a blob of XML  the hyperlinks containers are actually stored in the database as link objects. What your asking for is actually at least 4 different pieces of work (the check-box idea would if anything make this even more complex than the simpler case of any link that starts with http:// !) 

I have therefore broken the task down into several tickets, so we can tackle the ones we have easy solutions for and discuss the issues with the other ones separately/as required.

- External links in related sites navigation bar: http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/665
- External links inBody text container: http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/750 (this ticket)
- External links in other rich text containers: open ticket as/if required
- External links in Hyperlink containers (all or just some?) : open ticket as/if required
- External links hardcoded in templates (need to figure out which links these are) : open ticket as/if required

In terms of links in the 'Body text container' (this ticket) we are working on a solution, which once in place could be rolled out to other containers / templates as required (applying it to any external link in any template/container seems a but rash / likely to result in unwanted issues).

Hope that clarify where we are with this piece/pieces of work/ticket.

Jamie

Cool - got it. Let me know what the proposal is for this, then!

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012

Did you ever come up with what you thought the best solution was here re. the body / rich text container (not all containers)

Or maybe a way of specifying which containers we're affected by this.

We need to give Liz a time/cost if possible (just got this specific case)
Costin by end of this week, please
Reassigning to Janos, as we're doing this via JQuery now.
looking at it now.

Hi Liz,

Expect this to take us a day to complete, roll out and test.

It may be progress quicker than that but have erred on the side of caution (additionally we may be able to reuse this technique on containers other than the body one later)

One day is fine. More than that may have caused issues, but that's
perfecto.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Liz, can you please have a look at this: http://l.tjp.hu/external.html (it's a copy of a l2012 page w/ external links)
Here's what the script does:

 - searches for all the links in the #MainContent area of the page AND all the links with the classname of "link-external"
 - if they're external (ie don't link to http://london2012.com/ or http://www.london2012.com/)
 - a little external-link icon appears on the left
 - and the link opens in a new window
 - and the hover title changes to / gets amended by 'External link opens in a new window'

As earlier mentioned, it may involve a bit of adjusting to apply this behavior to external links in other areas than the main content - probably it's wise to roll it out first for the main content and see how it works. As it gets approved, it's relatively straightforward to put it live.

This looks fantastic! How do we do it in the CMS? Just enter the url?
Do we need to click the 'open in new window' box?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

It can go live anytime (when we get a thumbs up). When you enter an external (not 2012) url, the little icon will appear. Also, it will open in a new window automatically, but it's probably still a good practice to click the 'open in new window' box in case the user doesn't have javascript enabled.

Cool - presumably it will only take affect when we republish pages?

Hi Liz,

Are the fields that get carried across, fairly basic input fields (not 
rich text areas) ? and can a set be decided on before we start work?

We could certainly modify the confirmation page to carry across and 
resubmit certain fields, with modest effort, but dealing with block of 
text may be harder.

So before I estimate anything do you know what fields you want to do 
this with?

thanks

Jamie

--

But I'll be 100% open and frank with you here, what I'd really like to 
do is scrap what we have and start again but that is very hard to 
justify for either of us (even if a compromise was reached on who 
picked up the bulk of that; us I would assume) !

The main issue is the Event and OW Event forms we're to some extent 
coded with a single set of values we thought we're unlikely to change, 
so when we change a field at the moment we're making the change in 
half a dozen places (Form, API, Event screen, Template, Export); In 
hindsight some additional work upfront to make changes easier would 
have paid off by now.

That said if the fields they want to carry across are fairly basic we 
should be OK; It's just that if I was to code this from scratch right 
now I woudl probably handle it differently (that's not to say the 
initial way was ness. bad, rather it was designed for tweaking/ 
additions)

yes, fairly basic input fields. take a look at the existing form. but it's name, org details, contact, etc. so not all the event specific details, i don't think, but the organisation ones. i can check with the team if you want precise-ness, tho!
yes, we would definitely decide before you started tho.

I believe I am correct in saying that pictures added to picture boxes are not cropped, but are just resized, maintaining the aspect ratio of the original. 

In this case, the picture has a lot of white space around it (i.e. it's 700 x 700 px), which may have been a mistake. The best way to handle this may be to crop the picture before importing it.

I should qualify my previous comment: some picture boxes are set to crop and others aren't. I don't believe the box in the news article template is, but even if I am wrong, the amount of white space around the image would almost certainly not give you the desired result.
Another addendum: on the other hand, a crop might work OK. We are looking at it now, although  we see that you have done a manual crop for now.

Liz,

There is currently no auto cropping on that image, it looks like the 
vast number of them have been done by hand? *

But no the one you just tried...

Do you want me to add cropping at 460x250? [this will mean any images 
manually uploaded over 250px deep will get cropped the next time their 
page is edited]

Jamie

* I was as amazed by that as you but I;m almost certain that is the 
case, due to where the image live (the resized one get a different path)
Marking as solved.

It's taken a bit less than a day for me and a couple hours for K (he had to fiddle a bit to enable uploading psds) and it's not going to be a lot longer. Will put this to pending in an hour or so with full instructions.

So - example in the /Temporary/banner test folder, to see,
http://www.london2012.com/temporary/banner-test/my-psd-banner.php

To reproduce:
- Create a new page with the 'banner download' template
- upload the preview picture (one that appears on that page) to the same directory as the page
- create a subfolder called Downloads (name hardcoded) for the actual assets (psd/indesign/etc)
- upload the actual asset -with the same name- (just different extension) to the download directory
- edit the page - add the preview picture to the preview box
- and publish everything.

When the page is viewed live, the php will show the preview picture (say test_image.jpg) as usual, and if
- there's a download directory AND
- in the download directory there's a file with the same name but different extension (eg test_image.psd) there, it changes the download link to that one.
- otherwise it jsut lets you download the preview picture (like before)

It looks to me as if you did the following:

Requested a password reminder at 1:30pm.

For some reason (perhaps the above reminder did not arrive?) you requested a second password reminder at 3:15pm.

The link that you mentioned in your bug report (the one ending with "LO") was in the reminder sent at 1:30pm. When the second reminder was sent (at 3:15pm), this first one was then invalidated.
Did another reminder arrive, after 3:15pm? And - if so - does the link in this email (ending with "5t") work?
Kieran

Jamie

I haven't made a full investigation yet, but it appears that you have two CMS accounts.
One named "pjennings" and another named "Paul.Jennings".
I think that if you log in as the latter, it should be ok.
If you have forgotten the password for that account, then please click the "reset password" link, but specifying a username of "Paul.Jennings" rather than "pjennings".
I hope this makes sense?
Kieran
